command: $ErrorActionPreference='Stop'; $pscp='pscp.exe'; $log="$env:ProgramData\NetAdmin\logs\T1597.log"; $host='sftp.domaintools.com'; $user=$env:DT_USER; $key=$env:DT_PPK; $hostkey=$env:DT_HOSTKEY; $remote='/bulk/pdns/daily/pdns-2025-09-30.json.gz'; $dest='C:\Intel\DomainTools\pdns-2025-09-30.json.gz'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $dest) -Force | Out-Null; try { & $pscp -scp -batch -q -C -P 22 -i $key -hostkey $hostkey "$user@$host:$remote" "$dest"; if($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0){ throw "pscp exit code $LASTEXITCODE" }; $hash=(Get-FileHash -Algorithm SHA256 -Path $dest).Hash; $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; sha256=$hash; success=$true; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } catch { $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; success=$false; error=$_.Exception.Message; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } finally { $json=$status|ConvertTo-Json -Compress; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $log) -Force | Out-Null; Add-Content -Path $log -Value $json; Write-Output $json }
explanation: Acquires a commercial passive DNS daily export from DomainTools using SCP with host key pinning and logs a concise JSON result.
rationale_steps: Reach a closed-source DNS intelligence provider using SSH key auth and pinned host key.
Download a specific date-scoped dataset to minimize unnecessary transfers.
Compute a file hash and log structured metadata for validation and audit.
Stay within the scope of closed-source collection per T1597.
